ml4bio.py¶

class ml4bio.Training_thread(app, end)¶

An instance of this class is a thread for training classifiers. It is different than the main thread in which the main window is run. By creating a new thread for training, the main window is not frozen. The user may inspect existing classifiers when training is in progress. This class inherits QThread.

Variables:app (App) – main window of the software (an instance of class App)
__init__(app, end)¶

Constructs a new thread for training.

Parameters:
  • app (App) – main window of the software (an instance of class App)
  • end (func) – function to be called once the thread emits a finish signal
_train()¶

Trains a classifier and returns the classifier to the main thread.

run()¶

Defines the behavior of the new thread once created. Here, training starts immediately in the new thread.

class ml4bio.App¶

Main window of the software. It inherits QMainWindow.

__init__()¶

Initializes the GUI.

clear(option)¶

Clears up changes made by user.

  • If option=’all’, the system is back to initial state. This is called by clicking on the finish button on the 3rd page.
  • If option=’train’, trained classifiers will be cleared. This is called by clicking on the return button on the 2nd page.
  • If option=’test’, the classifier selected for testing is no longer selected. This is called by clicking on the return button on the 3rd page.
Params option:‘all’, ‘train’ or ‘test’
data_summary()¶

Displays a summary of the loaded data.

decision_tree()¶

Trains and returns a decision tree classifier.

double_spin_box(val, min, max, stepsize, prec, parent)¶

Return a double spin box. This spin box allows double values.

Parameters:
  • val (float) – initial value
  • min (float) – minimum possible value
  • max (float) – maximum possible value
  • stepsize (float) – gap between neighboring values
  • prec (int) – precision (number of decimal points)
  • parent (QWidget) – parent widget
Returns:

a spin box (QDoubleSpinBox)
error(flag)¶

Shows error messages in a message box.

Parameters:flag (str) – indicates the event that triggers the error.
error_message(flag)¶

Constructs error messages.

Parameters:flag (str) – indicates the event that triggers the error.
finish()¶

Finishs analyzing the current datasets. Asks user for future action (quit or start a new analysis).

finish_train(model)¶

Receives the trained classifier from the training thread and pushs the new classifier into the model table in the right panel.

Parameters:model (sklearn classifier object) – trained classifier
info(flag)¶

Shows reminders in a message box.

Parameters:flag (str) – indicates the event that triggers the reminder.
initUI()¶

Sets up the GUI.

k_nearest_neighbors()¶

Trains and returns a k-nearest neighbors classifier.

load(labeled)¶

Load a data file. Process the data and show a summary of it. It checks the data format and raises an exception if the data is in wrong format. Only .csv file with a header that contains feature names are accepted.

If the data is labeled, the label column must be the last column, and there must be at least 20 samples. An exception will be raised if fewer than 20 samples are present.

If the data is unlabeled, the feature names must match those of the labeled data. Extra white spaces are not allowed. An exception will be raised if the features do not match.

Parameters:labeled (bool) – indicates whether the data is labeled or not
logistic_regression()¶

Trains and returns a logistic regression classifier.

model_summary()¶

Displays a summary of the currently highlighted classifier.

naive_bayes()¶

Trains and returns a naive bayes classifier.

neural_network()¶

Trains and returns a neural network classifier.

page_title(str, parent)¶

Returns a page title such as Step 1: Select data. Such a title appears at the top of each page in the left panel. It shows at which step the user is in the training process.

Parameters:
  • str (str) – a page title
  • parent (QWidget) – parent widget (current page in the left panel)
Returns:

a page title (QLabel)
plot()¶

Shows plots of the currently highlighted classifier.

predict()¶

Makes prediction on new data using the selected classifier. Saves the prediction to a new file.

push(model, option)¶

Enters a classifier into the model table. Its performance metrics are added to the entry. Depending on _option_, it populates the entry with appropriate performance metrics.

Parameters:
  • model (sklearn classifier object) – trained classifier
  • option (str) – ‘train’ or ‘val’
random_forest()¶

Trains and returns a random forest classifier.

reset()¶

Resets hyperparameters of currently selected classifier type to default.

select(option)¶

Selects a classifier for testing.

  • If option=’best’, select the best-performing classifier based on the selected metric.
  • If option=’user’, select the classifier highlighted by user.
Parameters:option (str) – ‘best’ or ‘user’
set()¶

Prepares data for training. This includes the following steps:

  • Encode data (integer and one-hot encoding).
  • Generate train/test split.
  • Decide validation method (holdout, cv or loo).
  • Set classifier hyperparameters according to data.

After this function is called, the software proceeds to the 2nd step in training (i.e. train classifiers).

set_decision_tree()¶

Sets hyperparameters of decision tree to default.

set_k_nearest_neighbors()¶

Sets hyperparameters of k-nearest neighbors to default. The types of distances available depend on feature types. If the data has a mixture of discrete and continuous features, the user cannot train a k-nearest neighbors classifier.

set_logistic_regression()¶

Sets hyperparameters of logistic regression to default.

set_metrics(row, metrics)¶

Enters the metrics in an entry.

Parameters:
  • row (int) – index of the entry
  • metrics (ModelMetrics) – the collection of metrics to be entered
set_naive_bayes()¶

Sets hyperparameters of naive bayes to default. The type of distribution used depends on feature types. If the data has a mixture of discrete and continuous features, the user cannot train a naive bayes classifier.

set_neural_network()¶

Sets hyperparameters of neural network to default.

set_random_forest()¶

Sets hyperparameter of random forest to default.

set_svm()¶

Sets hyperparameters of SVM to default.

sort(col)¶

Sorts classifiers in descending order with respect to the selected metric.

Parameters:col (int) – index of the selected metric
spin_box(val, min, max, stepsize, parent)¶

Return a spin box. This spin box only allows integer values.

Parameters:
  • val (int) – initial value
  • min (int) – minimum possible value
  • max (int) – maximum possible value
  • stepsize (int) – gap between neighboring values
  • parent (QWidget) – parent widget
Returns:

a spin box (QSpinBox)
start_train()¶

Starts training by freezing the 2nd page so that user cannot alter the hyperparameters when training is in progress.

svm()¶

Trains and returns an SVM classifier.

switch_metrics(index)¶

Switchs among metrics on training, validation and test data. The metric values in all table entries change accordingly.

Parameters:index (int) – which set of metrics to display
switch_model(row, col)¶

Switchs among different classifiers in the table. A classifier summary and the plots for the newly highlighted classifier are generated.

Parameters:
  • row (int) – index of the selected entry
  • col (int) – needed for parameter passing but not used
test()¶

Tests the selected classifier. Computes metrics on test data and show them in the classifier’s entry.

title(str, parent)¶

Returns bolded titles in each page of the left panel. Such a title appears at the top of each section in a page. It highlights what the user is intended to do.

Parameters:
  • str (str) – a section title
  • parent (QWidget) – parent widget (current page in the left panel)
Returns:

a section title (QLabel)
train()¶

Trains a classifier in a new thread.

update_logistic_regression()¶

Sets hyperparameters of logistic regression according to the selected solver. Some options are enabled/disabled.

update_neural_network()¶

Set hyperparameters of neural network according to the selected solver. Some options are enabled/disabled.

update_svm()¶

Set hyperparameters of neural network according to the selected kernel. Some options are enabled/disabled.

warn(flag)¶

Shows warning messages in a message box.

Parameters:flag (str) – indicates the event that triggers the warning.
warn_message(flag)¶

Constructs warning messages.

Parameters:flag (str) – indicates the event that triggers the warning.
